title: [$250] Defer PopoverWithMeasuredContent rendering to idle time using React 19 concurrent features

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
coming from a proposal [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1763546273645229) ### Background: PopoverWithMeasuredContent renders popovers on large screens. On small screens, it returns a Modal (fixed bottom, no measurement). On large screens, it uses PopoverWithMeasuredContentBase, which measures content dimensions before positioning. The base component renders children in an invisible view to measure width/height via onLayout. After measurement, it computes anchor position, horizontal/vertical shifts, and final position using multiple useMemo hooks. These calculations run synchronously during render. The component is used across the app for dropdowns, menus, and popovers (e.g., PopoverMenu, EmojiPicker, UserSelectPopup, DatePickerModal). ### Problem: When the app is busy with priority UI updates, if PopoverWithMeasuredContent renders PopoverWithMeasuredContentBase on large screens, then it synchronously renders children and performs expensive measurement calculations, blocking priority UI updates ### Solution: Use React 19's useTransition to defer the initial render of PopoverWithMeasuredContentBase to idle time. This ensures measurement and positioning calculations run during idle periods, preventing them from blocking priority updates. Results: Heavy account (CPU 4x throttling): Test case: Switch tab from Inbox to Reports (list of submitted expenses) - Click event duration: 5.7s => 4.7s (-18%) - Time from click to displaying list items: 13.5s => 10s (-26%) Draft PR: https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/75426

body:
If you haven‚Äôt already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.60-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** kiatest.80+ck111425@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 11/Chrome, iPhone 16/iOS 18.3.1, Pixel 8a/Android 16 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat 3. Create 2 manual track expenses 4. Go to report details page 5. Click Add expense button present below the expenses 6. Select Track distance >> Switch to Map tab >> Select start waypoint 7. Tap back button to go back to report details page 8. Again tap Add expense button >> Track distance >> select start waypoint ## Expected Result: User able to select start waypoint to create distance expense via Add expense button in report details page. Hmm.not here page should not be displayed when selecting waypoints from second time onwards via Add expense button ## Actual Result: If the report contains manual track expenses, user cannot select waypoints to create distance expense via Add expense button present within the report details page. Hmm..not here page opens from second time onwards whenever user try to select start or stop waypoints ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/77a177e6-9eff-47a5-9c52-e501bcce044e [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
